document_data.caption: Trosken, tending bar.
document_data.name: Trosken Adze
document_data.mainbody: '''Trosken Adze''' was a [[dwarf|dwarven]] tavernkeeper who co-operated the [[Ball and Chain Tavern]] with his wife [[Alda Adze|Alda]] on the docks of the [[Wheloon Prison]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].{{DDO-time}}
document_data.Description: Trosken had a bald head and a long dark brown beard braided into two forks. He wore a neat green waistcoat, and stepped up on a short bench to reach the proper height while tending the bar.
document_data.History: Trosken used to be an [[adventurer]], but retired from it and became a tavernkeeper, seeing it as less risky and more profitable. The Ball and Chain became the first and only tavern to service the docks of the then-new Wheloon Prison
